title.narrative: Mapping of Synergies on Maputo Protocol
Mapping of Synergies on Maputo Protocol

description.narrative:
Det övergripande syftet med studien är att förse Sida och ambassaderna med rekommendationer om ingångspunkter för det svenska utvecklingssamarbetet och dess prioriteringar, relevans och komparativa föredelar, för stärkt genomförande av Maputo-protokollet.
Studien stödjer Sidas regionala sektion på ambassaden i Addis Abeba, SRHR-sektionen i Lusaka och övriga svenska ambassader som bedriver bilateralt utvecklingssamarbete i Afrika söder om Sahara att identifiera synergier med bäring på ratificeringen och genomförandet av och rapportering om Maputo-protokollet.

The overall purpose of the desk study is to provide Sida and the Embassies recommendations on entry points to strengthen the implementation of the Maputo protocol, considering Sweden’s development cooperation priorities, relevance and comparative advantage.
In effect, the exercise will support Sida’s regional team at the Embassy of Sweden in Addis Ababa and the SRHR team in Lusaka and the other Swedish embassies with bilateral development cooperation to identify synergies with bearing on the ratification and implementation of and reporting on the Maputo protocol.

The overall purpose of the mapping study is to provide Sida and the Swedish embassies with recommendations on entry points to strengthen the implementation of the Protocol to the African Charter on Human and Peoples\ Rights on the Rights of Women in Africa (the Maputo Protocol), considering Sweden’s development cooperation priorities, relevance and comparative advantages. The specific objectives were to; 1. Provide a brief overview of the Maputo Protocol, the reporting and follow-up procedures, country level mechanisms and mapping of key stakeholders at national and regional level. 2. Provide overview of priority areas of the Maputo Protocol that corresponds to Sweden’s Development Cooperation Policy priorities including as articulated in the Feminist Foreign Policy and the two regional and bilateral strategies. 3. Provide a short-updated context analysis on the status of the ratification, domestication and implementation of the protocol with up at least two brief country case studies of good practice on how the Maputo protocol has been domesticated after ratification. 4. Map and summarize Sida’s regional and country-level interventions by organization working to advance the Maputo protocol. 5. Map and summarize Sida’s regional and country-level interventions by thematic areas working to advance the Maputo protocol. 6. Based on the mapping, identify areas of overlap and synergies between regional and bilateral strategies. 7. Provide recommendation if possible, on how Sida more generally could work strategically with synergies between regional and bilateral development cooperation.

sector.narrative: Women’s rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The Mapping study has accomplished the following results, • Production of a report which has - provided general information of the Maputo Protocol and its status as a regional human right instrument. It has also analyzed the case studies of Kenya and Rwanda. - Discussed the Feminist Foreign Policy of Sweden and the thematic priorities expressed in the 17 bilateral and 2 regional strategies in relation to the articles of the Protocol. - Discussed the potentials for stronger synergies between ongoing and planned supports. - Provided recommendations to Sida and the embassies of Sweden in Africa on how the Maputo Protocol can be further advanced through Sweden’s development cooperation in the region. • Production of an information brief on the Maputo Protocol which provides an overview of the Maputo protocol, the African human rights system, progress of ratification and domestication of the protocol and outlines set of recommendation for Sida and other donors to support the advancement of the Protocol.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
